thread.title: Michelle Obama Seen Handing Out Free Soda Samples At Costco
thread.title_full: Michelle Obama Seen Handing Out Free Soda Samples At Costco

author: Jon Dougherty
title: Michelle Obama Seen Handing Out Free Soda Samples At Costco
text:
Michelle Obama delighted shoppers at a Costco in Livermore, CA, by promoting her new healthy beverage, Plezi Fizz.
A TikTok video shared on Tuesday captured the former first lady standing in front of a substantial display of the drinks, which were launched in March.
Customers gathered around Michelle and her bodyguard, eager to take photos, the DailyMail.com reported. Several photos were also posted to social media.
Michelle Obama at my Costco today giving out samples pic.twitter.com/UgYgF8J6Jv
‚Äî ùï∂ùñéùñóùñáùñò (@BasedKirby) September 18, 2024
@shakeandstirco2024 Costco in livermore! #costcodeals ‚ô¨ original sound ‚Äì Shake&Stir
In the 25-second video, Michelle Obama informed the audience that the beverage was healthy, calorie-free, and delicious. A Costco employee named Oscaldo told DailyMail.com that the event took place on Wednesday, during which Obama was promoting her new business.
Michelle Obama serves as the co-founder and strategic partner of Plezi Nutrition. According to the brand‚Äôs website, she is guiding the company to become a leader in creating healthy food and beverage brands, the outlet reported.
On the company‚Äôs website, she noted in a statement: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre starting with a beverage because we know how much concern parents and pediatricians have about sugary drinks.‚Äù
Plezi Fizz comes in three flavors: Lemon Lime Squeeze, Cherry Limeade and Strawberry Lemonade. They reportedly contain 70 percent less sugar than other leading fruit juices.
Earlier this summer, the former first lady sent a gaslighting message to black Americans that voting in the November elections is ‚Äúcritical‚Äù to protecting their ‚Äúfreedom.‚Äù
‚ÄúJuneteenth is all about celebrating our collective freedom and fighting to protect it,‚Äù Obama said in a video posted on X.
‚ÄúOur power, our rights, and even our planet are on the ballot this year,‚Äù Obama said. ‚ÄúSo, now is the time to think about how you‚Äôre going to make your voice heard in this election.‚Äù
The desperate message comes as recent polling shows that former President Donald Trump may be on the verge of capturing a historic number of votes from black Americans.
The former first lady established the voter registration and engagement organization ‚ÄúWhen We All Vote‚Äù in 2018, and pushed her 22 million followers on X to visit the group‚Äôs website.
‚ÄúGet yourself registered to vote, and then text three friends to do the same,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúDo not sit on the sidelines this year, because this is a critical moment for all of us.‚Äù
WATCH:
On Juneteenth, we celebrate our freedom, our resilience, and our progress. Today we‚Äôre honoring all the Black folks who came before us ‚Äì who helped build our country with their bare hands ‚Äì who marched and fought to do everything they could to build a better future for us all.‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/NmdjgcUK3t
‚Äî Michelle Obama (@MichelleObama) June 19, 2024
During a January interview on Jay Shetty‚Äôs ‚ÄúOn Purpose‚Äù podcast, Obama put out another over-the-top call to action, claiming she was ‚Äúterrified about what could possibly happen‚Äù in the election.
‚ÄúBecause our leaders matter,‚Äù she then said. ‚ÄúWho we select, who speaks for us, who holds that bully pulpit ‚Äî it affects us in ways that sometimes I think people take for granted.‚Äù
In March, Obama‚Äôs office confirmed again that she ‚Äúwill not be running for president,‚Äù as many had speculated she would amid disturbingly low poll numbers for Biden.
‚ÄúAs former first lady Michelle Obama has expressed several times over the years, she will not be running for president,‚Äù Crystal Carson, director of communications for Obama‚Äôs office, told NBC News at the time.
‚ÄúMrs. Obama supports President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris‚Äô re-election campaign,‚Äù she added.
Others continued to predict that the former first lady would eventually throw her hat into the ring, but that was before President Biden chose to end his reelection bid and essentially anoint Harris as his successor, which the Democratic Party officially did at its August convention.
